review_title: Great people trying to make a difference
job_title: Registered Nurse in West Chester, PA
pros: The work experience is fantastic.  The staff is wonderful, the patients/clientele are above average.  Overall a great place to work.
cons: Getting training approved is impossible.  They say they want you to continue to learn but turn you down at everyopportunity.  You get pigeon holes in a department - majority of the other units do not "play well" with one another despite being friendly.  If you never plan on leaving or advancing, it's a great place to work.  Getting a reference from HR is like pulling teeth.  They simply don't want to deal with you if you are not an employee.  Plan on it taking a long time to get hired as well - they take 6 months + just to schedule an interview.

job_title: Anonymous in West Chester, PA
pros: Amazing benefits make up for average salaries. Raises and bonuses do not exist. You get a small cost of living adjustment each year.
cons: The Chester County System was great until Penn took over. The quality of care has gone down. The long term CCH doctors have little say over things and everything is about numbers or getting patients down to Penn for testing. The Penn system is entirely too big and the right hand does not know what the left is going. Your oncologist doesn't talk to your cardiologist who doesn't talk to your primary. If I weren't an employee with covered care then I would go to Main Line Doctors.

job_title: Registered Nurse in West Chester, PA
pros: Friendly environment, patient focused, and very clean
cons: Some in management positions are horrible. No need to expand in this.  I don't care to sound bitter, or angry on this review, but more objective. However, some are very supportive, and support what I believe is the general attitude, and approach upper management would like to see in the work environment.

job_title: Laboratory Technician in West Chester, PA
pros: Decent compensation package including benefits, visually nice atmosphere (often described as hotel-like), nice location. Some departments function well as a team.
cons: Management backwards thinking, lack vision, political, work-life balance non-existant,  take advantage of certain employees based on opinion, little opportunity for training.
